alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 1:21PM EDT until April 09 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and northeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern New Jersey...Sussex and Warren. In northeast Pennsylvania...Monroe. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated ongoing flooding due to last night`s heavy rainfall. - For Flat Brook at Flatbrookville: At 12:30pm the stage was 7.65 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
